H0.text: An increase in flooding downstream is a disadvantage of the construction of Hoover Dam on the Colorado River, which provided abundant freshwater and electrical power for the region.

H1.text: An increase in regional humidity is a disadvantage of the construction of Hoover Dam on the Colorado River, which brought abundant freshwater and electrical power to the region.

H2.text: A decrease in the amount of river ecosystems is a disadvantage of the construction of Hoover Dam on the Colorado River, which provided abundant freshwater and electrical power for the region.

H3.text: A decrease in the amount of water for irrigation is a disadvantage of the construction of Hoover Dam on the Colorado River, which created abundant freshwater and electrical power for the region.

A4.text: The construction of the dam has been implicated in causing the decline of this estuarine ecosystem.

A5.text: For six years after the construction of the dam, while Lake Mead filled, virtually no water reached the mouth of the river.
